DOC.detailed_description: The Affordable Care Act ( ACA ) call every state United States ( US ) expand Medicaid coverage individual â‰¤138 % federal poverty level 2014 . In 2012 legal challenge , Supreme Court rule state require implement ACA-sponsored Medicaid expansion ; thus ( December 31 , 2014 ) , 27 state District Columbia expand Medicaid , 23 state . Little known impact ACA-sponsored Medicaid expansions access change receipt healthcare service among vulnerable population . Yet knowledge essential inform deliberation 'non-expansion ' state regard whether expand Medicaid program , also helpful 'expansion ' state eager learn impact expansion . The natural experiment create Supreme Court decision make expansion optional state provide unique opportunity ass extent Medicaid expansion improve access healthcare low-income patient vulnerable population . The propose project one first examine change access receipt healthcare service Medicaid expenditures follow ACA Medicaid expansion among large population safety net clinic patient . The investigator use electronic health record data ( EHR ) OCHIN practice-based research network , serve > 1 million patient 442 community health center ( CHCs ) 8 expansion state 8 non-expansion state . Moreover , use CHC data 8 expansion-states , investigator examine difference utilization among patient gain new Medicaid coverage ( newly insure ) , compare already insure Medicaid ( already insure ) , remain uninsured ( uninsured ) . Finally , investigator link EHR data 213 OCHIN clinic Oregon Medicaid administrative claim data assess overall healthcare utilization ( include care receive outside CHCs , hospitalization ) compare Medicaid expenditures among newly insure individual versus already insure . The investigator address follow specific aim : Aim 1 : compare pre-post health insurance status , primary care , mental health , dental visit , receipt preventive service , well change payer mix among OCHIN CHCs state expand Medicaid ; Aim 2 : Examine pre-post utilization CHC service ( include receipt preventive service ) newly insure patient compare already insured patient uninsured patient ; , Aim 3 : Measure pre-post Medicaid expansion change overall utilization healthcare service cost Oregon Medicaid program among newly insure compare already insure .
